title: Build landing pages: Education/curriculum (Certification Exam Prep Resource Hub, State Curriculum Standards Reference)
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Build sample landing pages for your assigned website ideas.

## OUTPUT LOCATION
Write to /Users/davidsenack/gt/income_sites/mayor/rig/landing-pages/{idea-name}/ directory for each idea:
- index.html
- styles.css
- script.js

Create directories as needed.

## REQUIREMENTS

### HTML (index.html)
- Semantic HTML5 structure
- Mobile-first responsive design
- Include meta viewport tag
- Link to styles.css and script.js
- Sections: hero, features/benefits, how it works, call-to-action, footer

### CSS (styles.css)
- Clean, modern aesthetic
- CSS custom properties for colors
- Mobile-first with media queries for larger screens
- No frameworks - vanilla CSS only
- Professional typography (system fonts or Google Fonts link)
- Subtle shadows and borders for depth

### JavaScript (script.js)
- Vanilla JS only - no frameworks
- Smooth scroll for anchor links
- Simple interactivity (e.g., mobile menu toggle, FAQ accordion)
- Keep it minimal and functional

### Design Guidelines
- Professional, trustworthy appearance
- Clear visual hierarchy
- Readable typography (16px+ base)
- Adequate whitespace
- Muted, professional color palette
- No emojis in the UI

### Content
- Use placeholder text that reflects the actual site concept
- Include realistic section headings
- Add placeholder CTAs relevant to the monetization model
- Include a simple footer with copyright

## REFERENCE
Read your assigned idea files first to understand:
- The site name and purpose
- Target audience
- Key features
- Monetization model (affects CTA placement)

Then build landing pages that accurately represent each concept.

title: COMPLETED: Niche Communities ideas
description:
Completed two subscription website ideas for niche communities with recurring needs:

1. KeyboardVault (ideas/polecat-valkyrie/keyboardvault/)
   - Collection manager and group buy tracker for mechanical keyboard enthusiasts
   - Tracks boards, switches, keycaps, aggregates IC/GB announcements
   - Pricing: Free / $6 Collector / $12 Enthusiast
   - Includes: README.md, index.html landing page, styles.css

2. PlantShelf (ideas/polecat-valkyrie/plantshelf/)
   - Collection manager and care tracker for houseplant collectors
   - Watering reminders, propagation logging, plant identification
   - Pricing: Free / $5 Grower / $10 Collector
   - Includes: README.md, index.html landing page, styles.css

Both products:
- Target specific niche communities with genuine recurring needs
- Include real competitor analysis
- Have justified subscription models
- Complete landing pages with mobile-friendly CSS
- No external dependencies

Committed to main branch.

title: COMPLETED: Finance-Adjacent ideas
description:
Created 2 subscription website ideas for Finance-Adjacent (non-trading) theme.

Products created in /ideas/polecat-capable/:

1. NetWorthTracker - Personal net worth tracking dashboard
   - Subscription: $8/month or $72/year
   - Target: Mid-career professionals with multiple accounts
   - Value: Automatic account syncing, monthly reports, goal projections
   - Files: README.md, index.html, styles.css

2. BillAudit - Subscription monitoring service
   - Subscription: $4/month (Basic) or $9/month (Pro)
   - Target: Households with 15+ recurring subscriptions
   - Value: Price increase alerts, unused subscription detection, negotiation scripts
   - Files: README.md, index.html, styles.css

Both products include:
- Detailed README with competitive research, pricing justification, tech stack, roadmap
- Complete landing page with hero, features, pricing, FAQ sections
- Full CSS styling with mobile-responsive design

Committed and pushed to main.

title: Category 10: Niche Communities with Recurring Needs - 2 subscription website ideas
COMPLETED: Compliance & Documentation ideas
description:
Created 2 subscription website ideas for compliance, documentation, and process-heavy work:

1. PolicyKeeper (/ideas/polecat-cheedo/policykeeper/)
   - Policy document management for small businesses
   - State-specific templates with automatic legal update monitoring
   - Employee acknowledgment tracking
   - Competitor research: LegalZoom, Rocket Lawyer, SHRM, Blissbook, SixFifty
   - Pricing: $29-99/month

2. AuditBoard (/ideas/polecat-cheedo/auditboard/)
   - Recurring compliance checklists with audit trails
   - Scheduled tasks, photo evidence, immutable audit logs
   - For regulated industries: healthcare, food service, manufacturing, financial services
   - Competitor research: iAuditor, Jotform, Process Street, Qualio, Intelex
   - Pricing: $39-149/month

Each directory contains:
- README.md with full product spec
- index.html complete landing page
- styles.css all styling

Committed to branch polecat/cheedo-mkhi78rw

title: Competitor recon: weak spots in existing micro-SaaS
description: Survey existing micro-SaaS products. Find ones that are overpriced, abandoned, poorly designed, or missing key features. Output: 10 competitor weak spots with opportunity notes.

title: Ideas: Writers, editors, and publishing-adjacent niches
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Generate EXACTLY 2 passive income website ideas for the assigned theme.

## OUTPUT LOCATION
Write to /Users/davidsenack/gt/income_sites/mayor/rig/ideas/polecat-{ID}/ directory:
- idea-01.md
- idea-02.md

Create the directory if it does not exist.

## REQUIRED SECTIONS FOR EACH IDEA

Each idea file MUST include ALL of these sections with consistent Markdown headings:

### 1. IDEA OVERVIEW
- Name
- One-sentence elevator pitch
- Specific problem solved
- Clearly defined niche audience

### 2. MONETIZATION MODEL
- Primary revenue stream
- Secondary revenue streams (if any)
- Justification for why this monetization works

### 3. CONTENT / FEATURE SET
- Core pages or tools
- Static vs programmatic content
- Long-term defensibility or stickiness

### 4. TECHNICAL SHAPE
- Suggested tech stack (boring, modern)
- Data sources (if applicable)
- Build complexity: Low / Medium / High

### 5. DESIGN MOCKUP (TEXTUAL)
- Homepage layout (section by section)
- Tone and aesthetic
- Typography and color direction
- Mobile-first considerations

### 6. README SECTION
Include at the end a README-style section with:
- Project title
- What it does
- How it makes money
- Key features
- High-level setup steps
- Future improvements
- Why this project exists

## RULES
- No emojis
- No marketing fluff or hype language
- No SaaS models requiring continuous feature development
- No social-media-dependent traffic strategies
- Prefer boring, SEO-driven, evergreen, utility-based sites
- Assume solo builder / indie operator with limited time
- Production-quality Markdown formatting
- Be specific and actionable, not vague

- Homepage layout (section by section)
- Tone and aesthetic
- Typography and color direction
- Mobile-first considerations

### 6. README SECTION
Include at the end a README-style section with:
- Project title
- What it does
- How it makes money
- Key features
- High-level setup steps
- Future improvements
- Why this project exists

## RULES
- No emojis
- No marketing fluff or hype language
- No SaaS models requiring continuous feature development
- No social-media-dependent traffic strategies
- Prefer boring, SEO-driven, evergreen, utility-based sites
- Assume solo builder / indie operator with limited time
- Production-quality Markdown formatting
- Be specific and actionable, not vague

Build sample landing pages for your assigned website ideas.

Write to /Users/davidsenack/gt/income_sites/mayor/rig/landing-pages/{idea-name}/ directory for each idea:
- index.html
- styles.css
- script.js

Create directories as needed.

## REQUIREMENTS

### HTML (index.html)
- Semantic HTML5 structure
- Mobile-first responsive design
- Include meta viewport tag
- Link to styles.css and script.js
- Sections: hero, features/benefits, how it works, call-to-action, footer

### CSS (styles.css)
- Clean, modern aesthetic
- CSS custom properties for colors
- Mobile-first with media queries for larger screens
- No frameworks - vanilla CSS only
- Professional typography (system fonts or Google Fonts link)
- Subtle shadows and borders for depth

### JavaScript (script.js)
- Vanilla JS only - no frameworks
- Smooth scroll for anchor links
- Simple interactivity (e.g., mobile menu toggle, FAQ accordion)
- Keep it minimal and functional

### Design Guidelines
- Professional, trustworthy appearance
- Clear visual hierarchy
- Readable typography (16px+ base)
- Adequate whitespace
- Muted, professional color palette
- No emojis in the UI

### Content
- Use placeholder text that reflects the actual site concept
- Include realistic section headings
- Add placeholder CTAs relevant to the monetization model
- Include a simple footer with copyright

## REFERENCE
Read your assigned idea files first to understand:
- The site name and purpose
- Target audience
- Key features
- Monetization model (affects CTA placement)

Then build landing pages that accurately represent each concept.

title: COMPLETED: Health-Adjacent ideas
description:
Created 2 subscription website products for Health-Adjacent (non-medical) theme:

1. SleepScore Pro (/ideas/polecat-dementus/sleepscore-pro/)
   - Data-driven sleep improvement without wearables
   - Phone-based sleep detection and lifestyle correlation

Each product has:

title: COMPLETED: Education & Lifelong Learning ideas
description:
Created 2 subscription website ideas for Education & Lifelong Learning:

1. DeckVault - Professional flashcard deck library for spaced repetition learners
   - Target: Self-directed adult learners using Anki for deliberate skill acquisition
   - Subscription: Explorer (/mo) / Scholar (/mo) / Institution (/yr per seat)
   - Files: /ideas/polecat-rictus/deckvault/ (README.md, index.html, styles.css)

2. Syllabus - Structured self-study curricula for autodidacts
   - Target: Self-directed learners who want university-quality education without the institution
   - Subscription: Reader (/mo) / Scholar (/mo) / Cohort ( one-time)
   - Files: /ideas/polecat-rictus/syllabus/ (README.md, index.html, styles.css)

Both include complete landing pages with hero, features, pricing, FAQ, and mobile-responsive design. Real competitive research included for each.

title: Category 3: Small Businesses & Operations - 2 subscription website ideas
ReleaseNoteBot MVP
description: Micro-SaaS that generates weekly release note digests from GitHub repos. Users connect GitHub, pick repos, get weekly email summaries of merged PRs/commits. Free tier: 1 repo, 1 recipient. Pro tier (/mo): 10 repos, 10 recipients, GitHub Issue posting.

title: PRD: ReleaseNoteBot
description: Write comprehensive PRD for ReleaseNoteBot MVP
acceptance_criteria:
- Problem statement defined
- Target user personas identified
- MVP scope with explicit non-goals
- Pricing tiers documented (Free/Pro)
- Success metrics defined
- File at /docs/PRD.md

title: Demo Mode: Preview Digest
description: Public demo endpoint for conversion
acceptance_criteria:
- Endpoint: /api/demo or /demo page
- User pastes public repo URL
- Shows sample digest preview (no auth required)
- Rate limited (10/hour per IP)
- CTA to sign up
- Works for public repos only

title: Tests: Unit + Integration
description: Test coverage for core functionality
acceptance_criteria:
- Unit tests for digest generation (mocked GitHub data)
- Unit tests for categorization logic
- Integration test for weekly job (mocked email/GitHub)
- Test file structure mirrors source
- npm test runs all tests
- CI-ready (can run in GitHub Actions)

title: Deployment Documentation
description: Write deployment guide for single platform
acceptance_criteria:
- Pick one platform (Railway/Render/Fly)
- Step-by-step deployment instructions
- Environment variables list with descriptions
- Database setup instructions
- Cron/scheduler setup for weekly job
- File at /docs/DEPLOYMENT.md

title: README.md
description: Write project README
acceptance_criteria:
- What it is (1-2 sentences)
- How it works (brief overview)
- Local dev instructions (setup, run, test)
- Environment variables needed
- How subscriptions work (Stripe test mode)
- File at /README.md (or /releasenotebot/README.md)

title: Architecture Design
description: Design system architecture for ReleaseNoteBot
acceptance_criteria:
- System diagram with all components
- Data model for users, repos, subscriptions, digests
- Background job design (weekly cron)
- Security notes (token storage, scopes, rate limiting)
- File at /docs/ARCHITECTURE.md

title: Scaffold Next.js App
description: Initialize Next.js project with TypeScript, Prisma, Postgres
acceptance_criteria:
- Next.js 14+ with App Router
- TypeScript configured
- Prisma initialized with Postgres
- Tailwind CSS for styling
- Basic project structure in /apps/releasenotebot or /releasenotebot
- package.json with scripts: dev, build, start, db:push

title: NextAuth + GitHub OAuth
description: Implement authentication with NextAuth and GitHub OAuth
acceptance_criteria:
- NextAuth configured with GitHub provider
- OAuth scopes: read:user, repo (for private repos) or public_repo
- User model in Prisma with GitHub token encrypted
- Login/logout pages functional
- Session middleware protecting routes
- Environment variables documented

title: Repo Selection UI
description: Build repo selection and settings interface
acceptance_criteria:
- Page to list user's GitHub repos (from API)
- Checkbox to subscribe to repos (limit enforced by tier)
- Settings per subscription: cadence (weekly), recipients, timezone
- Save to database
- Show current subscriptions with edit/delete

title: Digest Generation Logic
description: Core algorithm to generate release note digests from GitHub data
acceptance_criteria:
- Fetch merged PRs (or commits) since last_run_at
- Categorize into sections: Highlights, Fixes, Docs/Chores
- Highlights: top 3 by labels/files changed/important flag
- Each item: title + link + 1-sentence summary
- Handle edge cases: no PRs, rate limiting, pagination
- Unit tests with mocked GitHub data

title: Email Sending
description: Email delivery for digests using Resend/Postmark/SendGrid
acceptance_criteria:
- Email provider integration (Resend preferred for simplicity)
- Email template for digest (clean, readable HTML)
- Send to all recipients for subscription
- Local dev uses console/log sink
- Handle delivery failures gracefully
- Test with mock provider

title: Stripe Subscriptions
description: Integrate Stripe for subscription billing
acceptance_criteria:
- Stripe SDK integration
- Two products: Free (default), Pro (/mo)
- Checkout flow for upgrading to Pro
- Webhook handling for subscription events
- User model tracks stripe_customer_id, subscription_status
- Feature gating based on tier (repo/recipient limits)
- Test mode works out of box

title: Weekly Job Runner
description: Background job to run weekly digests
acceptance_criteria:
- Cron-compatible job that runs weekly
- Fetches all active subscriptions
- Generates and sends digest for each
- Updates last_run_at per subscription
- Handles failures per-subscription (doesn't block others)
- Can be triggered manually for testing
- Integration test with mocked providers

title: Willingness-to-pay signals: validate demand exists

title: COMPLETED: Researchers & Analysts ideas
description:
Created 2 subscription website ideas for researchers & analysts:

1. DataSourceIndex - Curated database of 5,000+ public and commercial data sources for quantitative researchers. Search by domain, coverage dates, update frequency, and access methods. Subscription tiers: Researcher $29/mo, Professional $79/mo, Institution $249/mo.

2. LitReviewTracker - Literature review management system for academic researchers. Structured extraction templates, progress tracking, synthesis tools. Subscription tiers: Solo $15/mo, Researcher $29/mo, Lab $79/mo.

Files created at /ideas/polecat-dag/datasource-index/ and /ideas/polecat-dag/litreview-tracker/ with README.md, index.html, and styles.css for each.

title: Category 9: Compliance, Documentation & Process-Heavy Work - 2 subscription website ideas
Micro-SaaS Research: 10 Viable Ideas
description: Phase 1 research to identify 10 viable micro-SaaS ideas. Generate 40-60 raw candidates, narrow to 20, then select final 10 with full scoring.

title: Sector: Developer Tools & DevOps
description: Research 4-6 micro-SaaS ideas in developer tools/DevOps space. For each: name, target user, void/gap, 2-3 competitors, preliminary pain score (1-5). Focus on boring but necessary workflows. Return notes with sources/URLs.

title: Sector: Niche Communities & Hobbyists
description: Research 4-6 micro-SaaS ideas for niche communities/hobbyists (collectors, enthusiast groups, hobby businesses). For each: name, target user, void/gap, 2-3 competitors, preliminary pain score (1-5). Focus on boring but necessary workflows. Return notes with sources/URLs.

title: Sector: Small Business Operations
description: Research 4-6 micro-SaaS ideas for small business operations. For each: name, target user, void/gap, 2-3 competitors, preliminary pain score (1-5). Focus on boring but necessary workflows. Return notes with sources/URLs.

title: Sector: Content Creators & Writers
description: Research 4-6 micro-SaaS ideas for content creators/writers. For each: name, target user, void/gap, 2-3 competitors, preliminary pain score (1-5). Focus on boring but necessary workflows. Return notes with sources/URLs.

title: Sector: E-commerce & Retail
description: Research 4-6 micro-SaaS ideas for e-commerce/retail operators. For each: name, target user, void/gap, 2-3 competitors, preliminary pain score (1-5). Focus on boring but necessary workflows. Return notes with sources/URLs.

title: Sector: Professional Services
description: Research 4-6 micro-SaaS ideas for professional services (consultants, agencies, freelancers - NOT regulated professions). For each: name, target user, void/gap, 2-3 competitors, preliminary pain score (1-5). Focus on boring but necessary workflows. Return notes with sources/URLs.

title: Sector: Education & Training

title: Build landing pages: Finance-adjacent (Estate Planning Checklist Hub, Small Business Tax Deduction Directory)
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Build sample landing pages for your assigned website ideas.

## OUTPUT LOCATION
Write to /Users/davidsenack/gt/income_sites/mayor/rig/landing-pages/{idea-name}/ directory for each idea:
- index.html
- styles.css
- script.js

Create directories as needed.

## REQUIREMENTS

### HTML (index.html)
- Semantic HTML5 structure
- Mobile-first responsive design
- Include meta viewport tag
- Link to styles.css and script.js
- Sections: hero, features/benefits, how it works, call-to-action, footer

### CSS (styles.css)
- Clean, modern aesthetic
- CSS custom properties for colors
- Mobile-first with media queries for larger screens
- No frameworks - vanilla CSS only
- Professional typography (system fonts or Google Fonts link)
- Subtle shadows and borders for depth

### JavaScript (script.js)
- Vanilla JS only - no frameworks
- Smooth scroll for anchor links
- Simple interactivity (e.g., mobile menu toggle, FAQ accordion)
- Keep it minimal and functional

### Design Guidelines
- Professional, trustworthy appearance
- Clear visual hierarchy
- Readable typography (16px+ base)
- Adequate whitespace
- Muted, professional color palette
- No emojis in the UI

### Content
- Use placeholder text that reflects the actual site concept
- Include realistic section headings
- Add placeholder CTAs relevant to the monetization model
- Include a simple footer with copyright

## REFERENCE
Read your assigned idea files first to understand:
- The site name and purpose
- Target audience
- Key features
- Monetization model (affects CTA placement)

Then build landing pages that accurately represent each concept.

title: Ideas: Niche directories and reference utilities
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Generate EXACTLY 2 passive income website ideas for the assigned theme.

## OUTPUT LOCATION
Write to /Users/davidsenack/gt/income_sites/mayor/rig/ideas/polecat-{ID}/ directory:
- idea-01.md
- idea-02.md

Create the directory if it does not exist.

## REQUIRED SECTIONS FOR EACH IDEA

Each idea file MUST include ALL of these sections with consistent Markdown headings:

### 1. IDEA OVERVIEW
- Name
- One-sentence elevator pitch
- Specific problem solved
- Clearly defined niche audience

### 2. MONETIZATION MODEL
- Primary revenue stream
- Secondary revenue streams (if any)
- Justification for why this monetization works

### 3. CONTENT / FEATURE SET
- Core pages or tools
- Static vs programmatic content
- Long-term defensibility or stickiness

### 4. TECHNICAL SHAPE
- Suggested tech stack (boring, modern)
- Data sources (if applicable)
- Build complexity: Low / Medium / High

### 5. DESIGN MOCKUP (TEXTUAL)
- Homepage layout (section by section)
- Tone and aesthetic
- Typography and color direction
- Mobile-first considerations

### 6. README SECTION
Include at the end a README-style section with:
- Project title
- What it does
- How it makes money
- Key features
- High-level setup steps
- Future improvements
- Why this project exists

## RULES
- No emojis
- No marketing fluff or hype language
- No SaaS models requiring continuous feature development
- No social-media-dependent traffic strategies
- Prefer boring, SEO-driven, evergreen, utility-based sites
- Assume solo builder / indie operator with limited time
- Production-quality Markdown formatting
- Be specific and actionable, not vague
